page.title: 18 Howfield Manor and Farm
page.content: An important amenity in the Howfield Wood area exemplifies the growing importance of tourism to Canterbury in the seventies and eighties.Howfield Manor has become a hotel and guest house.Incidentally,the oldest part of this dwelling coincides almost exactly with the date of the first Domesday Survey.It has been a hotel since 1974.It has 12 rooms,7 of them bedrooms.It costs 35-45 pounds a day.People from Tokyo,Argentina and New Zealand are amongst the most distant guests.The hotel possesses a well with one and a half feet of water at the bottom.The well was built in the 12th century.At Howfield Wood Farm a thriving riding school has sprung up with the bridlepaths that run through the deciduous woods.
